docs.snippet: The mayor of a small borough in Pennsylvania has been censured by the local council and is facing calls to resign after he posted images on his Facebook page comparing President Barack Obama and his family to apes and referencing a noose.

headline.print_headline: Mayor of Small Pennsylvania Borough Censured for Anti-Obama Posts
headline.main: Mayor of Small Pennsylvania Borough Censured for Anti-Obama Posts

docs.snippet: A Times photographer surmounts obstacles to record from above a land affected by climate change.

headline.print_headline: Sandstorms and Broken-Down Four-by-Fours: Drone Footage in the Tengger Desert
headline.main: Sandstorms and Broken-Down Four-by-Fours: Drone Footage in the Tengger Desert

docs.snippet: An entrepreneur bets there is room in the crowded social media space for at least one more platform.

headline.print_headline: Social Network Aims at the Biggest Fans of Live Music
headline.main: Fans.Com Is a Place to Talk About Concerts

docs.abstract: Social network Fans.com is set to make its public debut with live feeds from Lockn' music festival; online platform will allow fans to build profiles and communicate with others based on concerts they have attended.

docs.snippet: The apparent lack of interest in Twitter Inc by potential suitors may force the social media company to consider a route anathema to aspiring tech startups: a major restructuring and cutting some its nearly 4,000 employees.

headline.print_headline: No Partner in Sight, Twitter Faces Tough Solo Choices
headline.main: No Partner in Sight, Twitter Faces Tough Solo Choices

docs.snippet: The terrorist assault on a Christmas market in the German capital killed 12 people, most of whom have not been identified, and wounded 48 others.

headline.print_headline: Avid Travelers, a Contented Expatriate, and a Diligent Driver
headline.main: Czech, Israeli, Italian, Polish and Ukrainian Citizens Were Among Victims of Berlin Attack

docs.snippet: How do you go through 180,000 images to find a handful that sum up the year? Jeffrey Henson Scales tells us how.

headline.main: Choosing the New York Times Pictures of the Year

docs.abstract: How do you go through 180,000 images to find a handful that sum up the year? Jeffrey Henson Scales tells us how.

docs.snippet: The tech community’s usual reticence about politics is being upended by the prospect of a President Trump, even as traditional fund-raising is lagging.

headline.print_headline: Specter of Trump Loosens Tongues, if Not Purse Strings, in Silicon Valley
headline.main: Specter of Trump Loosens Tongues, if Not Purse Strings, in Silicon Valley

docs.abstract: Silicon Valley companies, in break from tradition, are moving into political fray, spurred by growing dislike for Republican presidential nominee Donald J Trump; their disdain has led to more donations for Hillary Clinton.

docs.snippet: Ron Haviv’s own experience with finding long-lost rolls of unprocessed film led him to ask people to send him their own rolls of forgotten, undeveloped film.

headline.main: A Mission to Rescue Forgotten Photos

docs.abstract: Ron Haviv’s own experience with finding long-lost rolls of unprocessed film led him to ask people to send him their own rolls of forgotten, undeveloped film.

docs.snippet: It’s a time to read and reflect, and maybe even a chance for the past to inspire the present.
A trove of social media communications, including Facebook posts, will be used to prove a Houston-area man sought to join and support the Islamic State group, according to authorities.

headline.print_headline: Social Media Posts Could Be Key at Terrorism Trial in Texas
headline.main: Social Media Posts Could Be Key at Terrorism Trial in Texas
